messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1964
messages.msgSnippet: I haven t played the game so I can t say anything about the skill required. However THAT is the game that got Chaelene reading.  Nothing sparked her interest
messages.messageBody:
I haven't played the game so I can't say anything about the skill required.

However THAT is the game that got Chaelene reading. Nothing sparked her
interest like that game. Sometimes we were too busy to read for her and she
had to either wait or figure the words out. She started figuring the words
out, quickly!

Sharon
----- Original Message -----
From: <louisam1@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, April 21, 2002 8:23 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1964


> < Actually, it became an obsession for all of us once we got
> the Zelda games. >>
>
>
> Same here. I'm not obsessed, but I can see why they like it. I'm too
> awful at
> the game to get obsessed with it!!! I have zero coordination, it
> frustrates
> my ds to watch me play.
> He just beat the entire game after about a week of ownership. I think
> that's
> pretty amazing. I offered to have a party to celebrate....he just looked
> at
> me funny and said "Mom, it wasn't that hard."
> Well *I* thought it was!!!!
>
> Ren>>
>
> Actually they aren't easy, I used walkthroughs because my tolerance level
> for frustration is low. LOL If your son was able to get through that
> fast with no help I am impressed! Of course, don't we always discount
> the ability to do something that comes easy to us?
>
> Kris
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1964
messages.msgSnippet: Same here. I m not obsessed, but I can see why they like it. I m too awful
messages.messageBody:
< Actually, it became an obsession for all of us once we got
the Zelda games. >>


Same here. I'm not obsessed, but I can see why they like it. I'm too
awful at
the game to get obsessed with it!!! I have zero coordination, it
frustrates
my ds to watch me play.
He just beat the entire game after about a week of ownership. I think
that's
pretty amazing. I offered to have a party to celebrate....he just looked
at
me funny and said "Mom, it wasn't that hard."
Well *I* thought it was!!!!

Ren>>

Actually they aren't easy, I used walkthroughs because my tolerance level
for frustration is low. LOL If your son was able to get through that
fast with no help I am impressed! Of course, don't we always discount
the ability to do something that comes easy to us?

Kris

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1964
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/19/02 2:51:23 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/19/02 2:51:23 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Actually, it became an obsession for all of us once we got
the Zelda games. >>


Same here. I'm not obsessed, but I can see why they like it. I'm too awful at
the game to get obsessed with it!!! I have zero coordination, it frustrates
my ds to watch me play.
He just beat the entire game after about a week of ownership. I think that's
pretty amazing. I offered to have a party to celebrate....he just looked at
me funny and said "Mom, it wasn't that hard."
Well *I* thought it was!!!!

Ren
